However, some companies faced weaker-than-expected earnings.

title: What would make this a ‘full-marks’ Budget for the capital markets
summary: The upcoming Budget must focus not just on attracting capital but improving how efficiently it circulates through the economy. Faster corporate restructurings, stronger recovery mechanisms, better mobilisation of household gold and simpler capital-gains rules can meaningfully enhance market depth, investor confidence and long-term capital formation, earning the Budget full marks from markets.

title: Pack your portfolio with ‘good’ businesses, and let time work its magic: 8 large-cap stocks with an upside potential of up to 33%
summary: A wise man once said that, in life’s rear-view mirror, most market corrections (even those sparked by seemingly catastrophic events) appear like small blips on long compounding curves. The panic caused by the Adani-Hindenburg sell-off, the start of the Russia-Ukraine war, or even the global financial crisis of 2008 are events that are hardly spoken of today, even if they roiled the markets at that time. There are companies and businesses that have seen all these events and still grown steadily over the past couple of decades. If you have such companies in your portfolio, just ignore the current turbulence and let time do its compounding magic.
